attributes.action: Learn from COVID-19: abolish biological weapons
attributes.additional_details: COVID-19 warns us of the global disaster that biological warfare (using bacteria, viruses, fungi or other deadly organisms) would unleash. UN Secretary-General Guterres says: 'Scientific advances are reducing technical barriers which ... limited the potential of biological weapons.' Now more than ever, the public will welcome a bold initiative to revitalise the Biological Weapons Convention, making it – at long last – the instrument for securing permanent abolition of all biological weapons.
attributes.background: Government and Parliament rightly support international cooperation over present and potential pandemics. They should now use the UK's position in the United Nations by answering the call of the Secretary-General, on 26 March 2020, to strengthen and universalise the Biological Weapons Convention.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do to strengthen and universalise the treaty. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
